intro: Mesembryanthemum proximum, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is known for its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, adapting to hot, dry climates with its ability to store water in its thick leaves. Its flowers, which range in color from white to pink and yellow, bloom in the early morning and close by midday, a trait known as nyctinasty. Mesembryanthemum proximum is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
